tn.text: AT: "In the tenth year of the exile of King Jehoiachin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: in the tenth month on the twelfth day of the month
tn.text: "on the twelfth day of the tenth month." This is the tenth month of the Hebrew calendar. The twelfth day is near the beginning of January on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ezk:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

"the huge monster that lives in the water." Yahweh begins to compare Pharaoh with a monster that lives in the water. The monster is probably a crocodile. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Pharaoh, comparing him with a monster in the water.
sharp and bent pieces of metal or wood that people used to catch fish and other animals in the water
hard pieces of skin that are on fish, crocodiles, and other animals
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: they have been a reed stalk
tn.text: Yahweh compares the people of Egypt and Pharaoh with a reed stalk because the people of Israel relied on the Egyptians to help them in war, but the Egyptians were not strong enough to help them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
a plant that grows near water and looks like very large grass
the part of a reed that is long and like a thick stick. People can use them like sticks, but the stalks of reeds are not as strong as wood and can break suddenly.
The word "you" refers to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: you shattered their legs and made their hips to shake
tn.text: "you injured their entire hip" God is speaking here of the harm that the Israelites experienced when they trusted in the Egyptians to defend them against Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Pharaoh.
AT: "Look!" or "Listen!" or "Pay attention to what I am about to tell you!"

The word "you" is feminine singular and refers to the nation of Egypt. Nations were often thought as if they were individual women. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
The word "you" is masculine singular and refers Pharaoh.
AT: "In all of Egypt" or "from the northern border of Egypt to the southern border of Egypt." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: no wild animal's foot will pass through it
tn.text: "not even an animal will walk through it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Pharaoh.
AT: "I scattered them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: will restore the fortunes of Egypt
tn.text: "will give Egypt what it had lost"
the southern part of Egypt between the Delta and the land of Cush. This is also called Upper Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues giving Ezekiel his message to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: The Egyptians will no longer be a reason for confidence for the house of Israel
tn.text: "The nation of Israel will no longer trust in the Egyptians"

tn.ref: when they turned to Egypt for help
tn.text: "whenever they went to Egypt for help"
seventh year** - AT: "in the twenty-seventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: on the first of the first month
tn.text: "on the first day of the first month." This is the first month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the beginning of April. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
